fullName: City, University of London Library Services
text:
Eid ul-Adha, one of the two main Islamic festivals celebrated worldwide, falls on 12 - 15 August this year. We would like to use this as a chance to celebrate the cultural richness of the different Muslim countries and communities, fostering learning and better understanding among cultures.

Traditionally lasting for four days, the first day of Eid ul-Adha marks the end of the yearly Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca. The focal point of the celebration is a feast that is shared with family, friends and the local community, sometimes rounded off with a festival or funfair.

To learn more, have a look at the selection of books on display here, search for more on CityLibrary Search, or have a good old browse through our CD and DVD collection on Level 2 ("A Separation", "Timbuktu", or "Afghan Star" - all ready for your exploring eyes).

Eid Mubarak, everyone!

text:
To coincide with the BBC's Proms we have compiled a display of books about music.  Reflecting the Proms, this is mostly a classical music display - but look out for a bit of jazz and hip-hop - both here and at the Proms itself. 

Keep an eye on BBC iPlayer and Box of Broadcasts for concerts of all kinds and check out CityLibrary Search for music resources such as Naxos Music Library, Music Online: Premium & Oxford Music Online .
